items.title: Recent works
items.summary: My late work is using mixed media (usually native wood) and glass - paints are inspired by traditional Maori tattoos
items.content_html: My late work is using mixed media (usually native wood) and glass - paints are inspired by traditional Maori tattoos

items.title: Sculptures

items.content_html: I explore different techniques and materials creating sculptures and bigger solitaires.

items.title: Kings Theatre Creative
items.summary: My recent works are now on display in the Kings Theatre Creative gallery in the Kawakawa, Bay of islands.
items.content_html:
My recent works are now on display in the Kings Theatre Creative gallery in the Kawakawa, Bay of islands.

The exhibition runs from 27th November till 20th December - you can find more about the event on facebook

Three Master artists explore their traditional practice and culture in sculpture, glass and paint. Ludek Adamek (Czech Republic), Anna Klekottka (Germany), and Beatrice Bourhis (Bulgaria) deliver a unique and diverse show, inspiring the imagination and a push to take old traditions to new places.
Showing 27 Nov - 20 Dec.
Open 5 Days Wed - Sun 10am - 3pm.
Kings Theatre Creative, 80 Gillies St, Kawakawa.

items.title: Kaan Zamaan
items.summary: My first exhibition after coming to New Zealand from Europe (January 2015, Kerikeri, New Zealand).
items.content_html:
My first exhibition after coming to New Zealand from Europe (January 2015, Kerikeri, New Zealand).

I was very lucky to meet Julia Reinholt in Kerikeri soon after my arrival and after I settled in the new home it didn't take a long and I've got an opportunity to showcase all my original art work I brought from the Czech Republic in her beautiful gallery.

items.title: Unicov
Contact
items.summary: The preferred way of contacting would be via email at ludek@glassart.nz. In case you need to talk to me urgently…
items.content_html:
The preferred way of contacting would be via email at ludek@glassart.nz.

In case you need to talk to me urgently you can try my cell 021 1240402 or our landline 028 2557 8851.

You are welcome to visit me at my workshop in Far North. I'm just 5kms away from Mangonui, a little town in beautiful Doubtless Bay (please don't confuse it with Mt Manganui in Tauranga :-) Fell free to send me an email and I'll send you back my address.
